programme.title: Animals Gone Wild
programme.desc: When your number's up, it's up. Or is it? When fight or flight instincts kick in, anything is possible, and animals will do anything to survive. From heroic acts of bravery to narrow escapes and near misses, expect the unexpected when creatures big and small encounter the animal kingdom's strangest curve balls in Animals Gone Wild: Shock & Awe.

programme.title: Animals Gone Wild
programme.desc: From the deepest seas to the tallest mountains, animals continuously surprise us and prove yet again that when it comes to Mother Nature, there is always an exception to the rule. These animals go against the grain, whether cheating death or forming odd friendships- it's Animals Gone Wild: Surprisingly Human. .

programme.title: Queens
programme.desc: The coastal realm of land and sea is home to two of nature‚Äôs most iconic females ‚Äì orca and grizzly bears. Under the waves in the Gulf of California, the orca family‚Äôs success relies on the experience of their sixty-year-old matriarch; while on the beaches of Alaska, a first-time bear mother must raise her three cubs alone and with only her instincts to guide her.

programme.title: Animals Gone Wild
programme.desc: How outrageous can the animal kingdom get? Whether its out-of-bounds behavior or savage instincts run amok, when animals act out, theyre a force to be reckoned with. From the mysterious depths of the deep blue sea to the jungles untamed edge, see just how rough, rowdy, and lawless Mother Natures most unruly creatures can be.

programme.title: Animals Gone Wild
programme.desc: When your number's up, it's up. Or is it? When fight or flight instincts kick in, anything is possible, and animals will do anything to survive. From heroic acts of bravery to narrow escapes and near misses, expect the unexpected when creatures big and small encounter the animal kingdom's strangest curve balls in Animals Gone Wild: Shock & Awe.

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: Each year, monarch butterflies undertake a multi-generational migration from Mexico all the way to Canada and back again. .

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin ventures into Australia‚Äôs notorious wetlands to discover three animals built for the muggy and wet environment. Phil comes face to face with the uniquely Australian freshwater crocodile, a massive predatory fish called the barramundi, and the saltwater crocodile, one of the world‚Äôs most dangerous animals and largest reptiles.

programme.title: Built To Survive
programme.desc: Indigenous educator Phil Breslin heads along the cliffs and sandy flats of the Australian coast to discover which animal dominates the shoreline. His first encounter is with a white -bellied sea eagle, a bird with extremely sharp talons, followed by the estuarine stonefish, the most venomous fish in the world. Finally, Phil takes a closer look at the notorious stingray.

programme.title: Dr. Oakley, Yukon Vet
programme.desc: Dr. Oakley participates in a race pitting human runners against reindeer, five muskox undergo pregnancy tests, and Daisy participates in a family reunion.

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: In Africa's vast Serengeti Plain, one million wildebeest are taking a rare pause for the mothers to have their young in a massive birthing event. .

programme.title: Trials Of The Wild
programme.desc: When you've got it all, why would you give it all up? We expect animals to take the path of least resistance -- choosing the easiest and surest ways to get food, safety and comfort. But animals aren't always so predictable.

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how wolf packs hunt prey, offering new perspectives on the way they work together to locate, isolate and bring down large bison and musk oxen. An arctic wolf pack must make a kill before the harsh winter arrives, while further south, grey wolves take on prey 10 times their size.

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: In the wild, animals face life or death battles every day, from escaping deadly predators to fighting off fierce rivals. Sometimes brute force isn‚Äôt enough to prevail. Survival can depend on death-defying acrobatics, secret senses and hidden weapons - the extraordinary superpowers that help animals survive.

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how lions hunt large prey like buffalo and zebra, offering new perspectives on the way these predators stalk, chase and kill. A lone lioness relies on cunning to feed her newborn cubs, whilst a fearless pride tries to take down the biggest prey of all, a giant African elephant. .

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how wolf packs hunt prey, offering new perspectives on the way they work together to locate, isolate and bring down large bison and musk oxen. An arctic wolf pack must make a kill before the harsh winter arrives, while further south, grey wolves take on prey 10 times their size.

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly

Survival can depend on death-defying acrobatics, secret senses and hidden weapons - the extraordinary superpowers that help animals survive.

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: The battle between predator and prey is not always about power and strength. Knowing what lurks in the dark can mean the difference between life and death. Extraordinary powers that penetrate darkness give some creatures the edge, and the chance to live another day.

programme.title: Wild, Smart and Deadly
programme.desc: To win the game of life, it can take more than brute force. Animals with a super-powered sixth sense can get the edge on fast-moving prey, beat the elements, and find food in unlikely places.

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how lions hunt large prey like buffalo and zebra, offering new perspectives on the way these predators stalk, chase and kill. A lone lioness relies on cunning to feed her newborn cubs, whilst a fearless pride tries to take down the biggest prey of all, a giant African elephant. .

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how cheetahs hunt their prey, offering new perspectives on the tactics employed by these expert predators when stalking, chasing and bringing down antelope and wildebeest. Following a young cheetah mother over 18-months as she teaches her three cubs the secrets of the hunt.

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how Nile crocodiles hunt, offering new perspectives on the patient and precise tactics they use when ambushing migratory herds of wildebeest and zebra that pass through their territories. A male crocodile must target large prey in a bid to survive the harshest time of the year.

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how leopards hunt prey both large and small, offering a new perspective on the way these silent killers stalk and ambush everything from impala to wildebeest and catfish to storks. A female leopard deploys stealth, strength and agility to take down prey on land, in water and from the air.

programme.title: Predator V Prey
programme.desc: A forensic look at how wolf packs hunt prey, offering new perspectives on the way they work together to locate, isolate and bring down large bison and musk oxen. An arctic wolf pack must make a kill before the harsh winter arrives, while further south, grey wolves take on prey 10 times their size.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol: Compilation
programme.desc: Summer heat requires Dr. Pol to pivot his approach while treating a sick cow. A Great Dane and a thirty-year-old horse fall victim to icy ground. Dr. Brenda aids in a complicated springtime calving. From frigid temperatures to a sweltering sun, from muddy pens to dusty pastures, the conditions that Mother Nature creates in central Michigan for both animals and vets is a force to be reckoned with.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol
programme.desc: A major storm blows into Central Michigan, and as the snow piles up, so do the cases! While clients brave the weather to get care for their animals, Dr. Pol and Charles battle thundersnow when responding to an emergency farm call. Dr. Lisa needs ten stitches to repair a horses deep cut, and Dr. Brenda treats a Rottweilers very swollen face. .

programme.title: Killer Whale Chronicles
programme.desc: Orcas are the rulers of the seas. These majestic marine mammals have captured the hearts of people with their intelligence and complex family structures. However, since killer whales started attacking boats near Gibraltar, many are asking: Are they threatening us or just playing? The central revelation is that orcas, with specialized 'cultures,' perfectly exploit the richness of the seas.

programme.title: Killer Whale Chronicles
programme.desc: A central theme of this episode is the remarkable learning behavior of orcas, passed on from generation to generation. As marine biologist and wildlife filmmaker Florian Graner explores the mysteries of orcas, viewers immerse themselves in the different cultures of the orca populations in the Salish Sea.
